PitchArrayRow¶

class baca.tools.PitchArrayRow.PitchArrayRow(cells=None)¶

Pitch array row.

A pitch array row:

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)
>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> abjad.f(array[0], strict=89)
baca.PitchArrayRow(
    cells=(
        baca.PitchArrayCell(
            pitches=[
                abjad.NamedPitch("c'"),
                ],
            width=1,
            ),
        baca.PitchArrayCell(
            pitches=[
                abjad.NamedPitch("d'"),
                ],
            width=2,
            ),
        baca.PitchArrayCell(
            width=1,
            ),
        ),
    )

>>> array[0].cell_widths
(1, 2, 1)

>>> array[0].dimensions
(1, 4)

>>> array[0].pitches
(NamedPitch("c'"), NamedPitch("d'"))

Special methods

__add__(argument)¶

Concatenates argument to pitch array row.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> new_row = array[0] + array[1]

>>> print(new_row)
[c'] [d'] [ ] [ ] [ ] [e']

Returns new pitch array row.

__copy__()¶

Copies pitch array row.

Returns new pitch array row.

__eq__(argument)¶

Is true when argument is a pitch array row with contents equal to that of this pitch array row. Otherwise false.

Returns true or false.

(AbjadObject).__format__(format_specification='')¶

Formats Abjad object.

Set format_specification to ‘’ or ‘storage’. Interprets ‘’ equal to ‘storage’.

Returns string.

__getitem__(argument)¶

Gets cell or cell slice identified by argument.

Returns pitch array cell or slice of pitch array cells.

__hash__()¶

Hashes pitch array row.

Required to be explicitly redefined on Python 3 if __eq__ changes.

Returns integer.

__iadd__(argument)¶

Adds argument to pitch array row in place.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> row = array[0].withdraw()
>>> row += row

>>> print(row)
[c'] [d'] [ ] [c'] [d'] [ ]

Returns pitch array row.

__iter__()¶

Iterates pitch array row.

Returns generator.

__len__()¶

Gets length of pitch array row.

Length defined equal to the width of pitch array row.

Returns nonnegative integer.

__ne__(argument)¶

Is true when pitch array row does not equal argument. Otherwise false.

Returns true or false.

(AbjadObject).__repr__()¶

Gets interpreter representation of Abjad object.

Returns string.

__str__()¶

Gets string representation of pitch array row.

Returns string.

Methods

append(cell)¶

Appends cell to pitch array row.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(abjad.NamedPitch(0))
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(abjad.NamedPitch(2))
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(abjad.NamedPitch(4))

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d' e'    ] [ ]
[          ] [ ] [ ]

>>> cell = baca.PitchArrayCell(width=1)
>>> array[0].append(cell)
>>> cell = baca.PitchArrayCell(width=1)
>>> array[1].append(cell)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d' e'    ] [ ] [ ]
[          ] [ ] [ ] [ ]

Returns none.

apply_pitches(pitch_tokens)¶

Applies pitch_tokens to pitch cells in pitch array row.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([
...     [1, (0, 1), (0, 2)],
...     [(0, 2), (0, 1), 1],
...     ])

>>> print(array)
[  ] [c'] [c'    ]
[c'     ] [c'] [ ]

>>> array[0].apply_pitches([-2, -1.5])

>>> print(array)
[  ] [bf] [bqf    ]
[c'     ] [c' ] [ ]

Returns none.

copy_subrow(start=None, stop=None)¶

Copies subrow of pitch array row from start to stop.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> subrow = array[0].copy_subrow(2, None)

>>> print(subrow)
[d'] [ ]

Returns new pitch array row.

empty_pitches()¶

Empties pitches in pitch array row.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> array[0].empty_pitches()

>>> print(array)
[ ] [     ] [  ]
[     ] [ ] [e']

Returns none.

extend(cells)¶

Extends pitch array row with cells.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> cells = [baca.PitchArrayCell(width=_) for _ in [1, 1, 1]]
>>> array[0].extend(cells)
>>> cell = baca.PitchArrayCell(width=3)
>>> array[1].append(cell)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ] [ ] [ ] [ ]
[       ] [ ] [e'] [     ]

Returns none.

has_spanning_cell_over_index(i)¶

Is true when pitch array row has one or more cells spanning over index i. Otherwise false.

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([[1, 2, 1], [2, 1, 1]])
>>> array[0].cells[0].append_pitch(0)
>>> array[0].cells[1].append_pitch(2)
>>> array[1].cells[2].append_pitch(4)

>>> print(array)
[c'] [d'    ] [  ]
[       ] [ ] [e']

>>> for row in array:
...     for i in range(4):
...         i, row.has_spanning_cell_over_index(i)
... 
(0, False)
(1, False)
(2, True)
(3, False)
(0, False)
(1, True)
(2, False)
(3, False)

Returns true or false.

index(cell)¶

Gets index of pitch array cell in pitch array row.

Retunrs nonnegative integer.

merge(cells)¶

Merges cells.

Returns pitch array cell.

pad_to_width(width)¶

Pads pitch array row to width.

Returns none.

pop(cell_index)¶

Pops cell cell_index from pitch array row.

Returns pitch array cell.

remove(cell)¶

Removes cell form pitch array row.

Returns none.

to_measure(cell_duration_denominator=8)¶

Changes pitch array row to measures.

Sets time signature numerators equal to pitch array row widths and time signature denominators equal to cell_duration_denominator.

Changes row to measure:

>>> array = baca.PitchArray([
...     [1, (2, 1), ([-2, -1.5], 2)],
...     [(7, 2), (6, 1), 1]])

>>> print(array)
[  ] [d'] [bf bqf    ]
[g'     ] [fs'   ] [ ]

>>> measure = array.rows[0].to_measure()
>>> abjad.show(measure, strict=89)

Returns measure.

withdraw()¶

Withdraws pitch array row from parent pitch array.

Returns pitch array row.

Read/write properties

pitch_range¶

Gets and sets pitch range of pitch array row.

Returns pitch range.

Read-only properties

cell_tokens¶

Gets cell items of pitch array row.

Returns tuple.

cell_widths¶

Gets cell widths of pitch array row.

Returns tuple.

cells¶

Gets cells of pitch array row.

Returns tuple.

depth¶

Gets depth of pitch array row.

Defined equal to 1.

Returns 1.

dimensions¶

Gets dimensions of pitch array row.

Returns pair.

is_defective¶

Is true when width of pitch array row does not equal width of parent pitch array. Otherwise false.

Returns true or false.

is_in_range¶

Is true when all pitches in pitch array row are in pitch range of pitch array row. Otherwise false.

Returns true or false.

parent_array¶

Gets parent pitch array housing pitch array row.

Returns pitch array or none.

pitches¶

Gets pitches in pitch array row.

Returns tuple.

row_index¶

Gets row index of pitch array row in parent pitch array.

Returns nonnegative integer.

weight¶

Gets weight of pitch array row.

Defined equal to sum of weights of pitch array cells in pitch array row.

Returns nonnegative integer.

width¶

Gets width of pitch array row.

Defined equal to sum of widths of pitch array cells in pitch array row.

Returns nonnegative integer.
